text: to add an example with standard careful preprocessing, including intersecting ROIs with grey matter and using anatomical compCor.
title: is there a minimal data with GM, WM and CSF masks ?

text: Well I wasn't thinking of a function, but just an example to demo a careful preprocessing pipeline.

Yes, but I am trying to make it "optimal"...
Is there any reason we can not add one spatially preprocessed subject with its anatomical masks, host it on nilearn NITRC and use it to demo preprocs ?
It can be for instance a subject from the surgical epilepsy

Sorry, just suggesting, don't know how much this is relevant
Ok, then I use the group masks

You could also try this: `datasets.fetch_icbm152_brain_gm_mask` or `datasets.load_mni152_brain_mask` for a simple canonical mask.

Similar idea is proposed in Issue #1104 which takes gray matter mask for example and compute confounds and return the same from out of mask (white matter mask) depending upon the number of confounds user wants.

is that something you are planning for ?
